name: Jerusalem International YMCA, Three Arches Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose 3 Arches because of location and that is perfect. However, the first room we were shown had not been made up.(after reservation made 3 months in advance) the bathroom was filthy and the room was musty, the safe did not close and it was the last room at the end of a long hall. After going to reservation desk, we were told they were full. When they checked how long ago the reservation was made, a room was found. It was perfectly fine. My objection to the hotel is that it in serious need of updating. The carpeting, drapes are shabby.
reviews.title: Needs sprucing up

reviews.text: The dining room (for breakfast) needs better management. When dishes at the buffet are near empty(or empty) they should be refilled as quickly as possible. A coffee urn should be on the outside terrace. It is dangerous to walk with hot coffee from the buffet thru the dining room,down a step to the terrace. If the terrace is used as a breakfast room it should be made easily accessible to the food.
reviews.title: Fantastic location and an amazing building ...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 4 nights, in rooms costing $85 each booked through booking.com. A little faded but clean and perfectly adequate. Breakfasts were delicious and plentiful. The restaurant at other times had a reasonable range of food, though it was expensive (35 NIS for a bowl of soup).Wi Fi is available at $22 for 3 days.
reviews.title: Miserable place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A very easy walk to the Jaffa Gate taking about 10 mins ... cross the road and follow the road right down the hill from the garage... lots of steps !
reviews.title: Stay anywhere but here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were not helpful, sadly, and the hotel needs to do a lot more in terms of offering advice on tourism in Israel.
reviews.title: Beautiful building, basic rooms and expensive restaurant...

reviews.text: The location was great – right near the Old City within easy walking distance of Zion Square. My room was rather small for $150/night, and I only had a single bed. The bathroom was clean, and basic toiletries and linens were provided. Free internet was only available on the ground floor. Not a bad place to crash for a night or two, but for longer stays find something cheaper.
reviews.title: Incredible location, but a bit overpriced

reviews.text: I stayed here for a somewhat last-minute weekend getaway on the back end of a business trip, as they had availability when most of the guesthouses in Jerusalem were already fully booked. As they don't have an online reservation system, I booked through an online third party reservation site (you can find it by searching for the hotel name on a search engine), and received a slightly better rate than the hotel was offering directly. Although somewhat nervous about staying at a "YMCA," I arrived to find a hotel in a beautiful setting, on a well maintained, beautiful property, with unique and stylish common areas. Our room, on the third floor, was basic, but clean and had a nice international-grade bathroom. The restaurant, although not cheap, features beautiful outside seating which gives a splendid view of the property, King David road and the famous King David Hotel. It was a great place to enjoy a beer or coffee after a busy day of exploring the city. The included buffet breakfast was on a "European standard" -- simple and adequate (but nothing spectacular). The location-- about a 10 minute walk though fancy Mamilla to get to the Jaffa gate of Old Jerusalem-- was convenient and offered easy access to the sites of Old Jerusalem while allowing a break from the crowds, touts, and zealous shop owners of the Old City. If you plan to hit some of the further sites, taxi's are always parked across the street (in front of the King David hotel). I would, and very well may, stay here again-- and will recommend it to others headed to Jerusalem.
reviews.title: Beautiful setting, great location, decent value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is the best in Jerusalem. Only few minutes walk from the old city gates, close to restaurants and other attractions.
reviews.title: Great location - average service

reviews.text: The service at the hotel is average at best. Front desk lady was always on the phone with personal calls and never seemed to care about customers. We had to get a manager to come out to have a simple question answered.
reviews.title: YMCA 3 Arches: a study in contrasts

reviews.text: For a trip into the past and also a stellar location in a very expensive city, I recommend this hotel and we will very likely stay there again. The hotel was built in the 1930's and the building is absolutely gorgeous in the lobby and common areas, especially the view from the top of the tower. The restaurant is lovely with a lovely outdoor patio. But in terms of the guests, there are a few problems. The YMCA has not prioritized most of the rooms, which have not been updated for years and are very plain, as in hostel-plain. There are very few amenities such as radio, toiletries, or more than one towel per guest. There is construction going on outside the rooms, although this is not the hotel's fault. The reservations system is sadly out of date and very confusing to navigate, usually resulting in needing more than one long distance phone call. They ask you to send your credit card information, but do not have a secure system. Reservations disappear mysteriously.
reviews.title: Check in for a pleasant stay in the heart of Jersalem

reviews.text: The exterior and lobby of the hotel (this is not a YMCA in terms of prices or setup) are very impressive, but the room I had was tired, the linen felt cheap and over worn, the pillows were thin and lumpy and I was nervous about walking barefoot on the carpet. Admittedly I turned up late with no reservation and probably paid over the odds at USD170 for one night but there are definitely better value hotels in Jerusalem.
reviews.title: Overpriced and rundown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Jerusalem is very expensive and the 3 arches is too. The name YMCA deceives, there are no dorms and 160 usd per night is too high for what they offer in hotel comfort. But you can park your rental car and walk to everywhere. We would make more prudent choices for accommodations if we were ever to return to the holy shopping capital in the land of Arafat.
reviews.title: top location, nice building, too expensive

reviews.text: Good value hotel in centre of Jerusalem (about 100$). Basic rooms, free parking, good location. If you travel on a budget I would go there.
reviews.title: 3 in a room value for money

reviews.text: Sadly, this hotel, in a beautiful building and wonderful location has not been kept up or maintained at all.
reviews.title: Don't stay here!!

reviews.text: The list of problems that I encountered here is very long, but the short list includes a dirty room and floor, insufficient hot water to shower, windows that do not close properly (they are the original windows from the 1930's), drapes that do not close so they do not block the very early morning light. Additionally, the furniture, etc. is all quite shabby - which is not as crucial as all the problems listed above.
reviews.title: Good Location, but not what it used to be...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although US$150/night may seem high, it is a very modest price to pay in Jerusalem. The hotel (pronounced by the locals as the "Yimca) is in the best location in the city. The staff is very helpful and friendly, and they do a good job of keeping the room and public places clean. In part, the room, which is a true hotel room, and not a typical "Y", was comfortable, and you can also feel good that in part, your stay helps support a vital mission of peace. The fitness center is first rate.
reviews.title: No complaints at all

reviews.text: While there is little reason to have a car in Jerusalem, there is free parking, and all the rental companies are right down the block.
reviews.title: nice hotel, great location..........overpriced

reviews.text: stayed her three nights................single room $137 (US) per night !.........Whoo....overpriced buy my standards........then again most of Isreal is overpriced by US standards........The hotel also have a nice resturant on location (overpriced also) , pool, gym, free internet in lobby only........staff is helpful........they do laundry.........walking distance to Jaffa Gate to old city......across the street from the very expensice David Hotel........(nice to visit this hotel) .........Hotel also has a tower..........can be seen for old city.........
reviews.title: The stay and location was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The YMCA is at a great location because of two reasons: (1) being right across from the most expensive hotel in Jerusalem ( the King David Hotel) the area was very neat and 2 blocks down from an upscale mall that takes you right into Old Jerusalem. (2) the grounds, neatness and access to all the amenities(including the resturant) a great free breakfast, the the price is very good! I highly recommend it.
reviews.title: Had a perfect stay!

reviews.text: The YMCA Jerusalem is the perfect place to stay while exploring the city, and that's not just because of the good price. The building's architecture itself is simply amazing and totally brings out that true 'Jerusalem' feeling. Also had good breakfast. There was plenty of choice in croissants and other pastries, bread, eggs, vegetables and drinks. The room was spacious and also had that beautiful authentic interior. Bathroom perfect and clean. It was only a 5-10 min. walk to the old city (Jaffa Gate), passing the King David Hotel, all kind of little boutiques, car rentals and the luxurious Mamilla mall. In the evening it's still a buzzy, lively atmosphere outside. I can recommend it to anyone!
reviews.title: Good for one night
